The possible values for "Funding source" are "privately-funded" and "publicly-funded."

Please output the organized data in the format of one Markdown table.
The column names are as follows in sequence: Ranking, Library, Institution, Library ID, Total Volumes, Funding Source.
Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the column without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```?

To start answering this question, I need the specific details of the top 50 libraries listed by IPEDS in 2023, including their names, institutions, IDs, total volumes, and funding sources. Since I don't have access to this data set right now, I'll need to search for it.

libraries.org: Academic Library Rankings - Library Technology Guides All US Academic Libraries. Association of Research Libraries Statistics published by IPEDS. These statistics have been loaded from the public data sets ...

Academic Libraries (AL) - IPEDS - Department of Education IPEDS collects information on collections, services, and expenditures at libraries at degree-granting institutions. Data collected include:.

Academic Libraries Resources Center The purpose of the Academic Libraries Survey (ALS) is to collect information on library resources, services, and expenditures from academic libraries.
